title: When I open the keyboard in messages/setting, a toast notification saying null pops up on the bottom
content:
UPDATE:
MAJOR THANKS TO KEITH WHO SOLVED THE PROBLEM. THE ISSUE IS DUE TO FIREFOX LOCKWISE. UNINSTALL THE APP AND IT WILL GO AWAY.
Every time I open up a google app (settings, play store, messaging, etc) and use the keyboard, a little toast notification (grey/white bubble at the bottom of the screen) pops up and covers the keyboard for a few seconds saying null. Every time without fail, a little bubble, and the word null. It happened right after I upgraded to android 11. It's very annoying.
Device: Pixel 4a
OS: Android 11
